chargeHist.descr: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler V Bronstad

records.addlTxt:
(1:30 PM cases 21CF1279, 22CF108, 22CF140 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tyler V Bronstad in court, in custody. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Tyler V Bronstad.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant inquires about not being on probation and what the length of jail time would be. Court instructs defendant to speak with his attorney.
Attorney Patek speaks with defendant.
Defendant pleads Guilty to 21CF1279 Count 1: Attempt Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer and 22CF108 Count 1: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer without Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CF1279 Count 1 and 22CF108 Count 1.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:
60 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on 21CF1279 Count 1. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete an Anger Management assessment and follow through with recommendations. No contact with Officer Adam Phillips or Officer Lue Khang outside their official capacity. No contact with Micon Downtown Cinema. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. 132 days credit on 21CF1279 and 129 days credit on 22CF108 if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including case 22CF140 are dismissed and read in.
Plea hearing on June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(9:58 AM cases 21CF1279, 22CF108, 22CF140 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tyler V Bronstad in court, in custody. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Tyler V Bronstad.
Attorney Patek requests a few minutes to speak with the defendant as received an amended offer yesterday.
(Off record to allow Attorney Patek to speak with the defendant.)
Attorney Patek advises the defendant would like to accept the State's amended offer.
Court notes discrepancies in the offer relayed to the Court by Attorney Patek.
Attorney Fallon indicates is covering for Attorney Gunderson and is unaware of what Attorney Gunderson's intentions were with the offer.
Attorney Patek indicates it would be best to reschedule this hearing.
Plea Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 1:30 pm in person.

10:27 AM cases 22CF108, 22CF140, 21CF1279 called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyler V Bronstad in court, in custody.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Tyler V Bronstad. Defendant needs to meet with Mr Judd and will be doing so June 2nd. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for June 8th at 10:00 AM (in person).

(8:59 AM cases 21CF1279, 22CF108, 22CF140 called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tyler V Bronstad in court, in custody. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Tyler V Bronstad.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas, which the Court receives. 
Attorney Patek advises there is an agreement for a DAGP resolution but the defendant still needs to meet with the DAGP Coordinator.
Plea Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:30 am in person.
Same as the Criminal Complaint

9:47 AM Cases called: 21CF1279, 22CF108, 22CF140. Defendant Tyler V Bronstad in court, in custody.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Tyler V Bronstad. District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CF108 & 22CF140: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

All cases set for a STC: 05/06/22 at 9am
Status conference on April 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.

1:56 PM Cases called: 21CF1279, 22CF108 & 22CF140. Defendant Tyler V Bronstad appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Zebulon Patek for Tyler V Bronstad appeared in court, Attorney Andrew James Gunderson for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Parties are in receipt of and have reviewed of the Competency Report by Dr. Harlan Heinz. Parties will stipulate to the findings of the report; that the defendant is competent. Defendant agrees that he is competent to proceed. Report is admitted. Court makes finding that the Defendant is competent to proceed. Preliminary Hearings in these files will be addressed at the next hearing. Status Conference: 04/07/22 at 9:45am

of Dr. Harlan Heinz
*CONFIDENTIAL*
Competency hearing on March 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Dated 02/28/2022, Letter from Dr. Harlan Heinz to Court regarding pending competency evaluation and report.

Case called at 11:17 AM.
Defendant Tyler V Bronstad appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson,  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State notes that when the Defendant appeared yesterday the State intended to ask for a Cash Bond but mistakenly requested a Signature Bond. State requests $3,000 Cash Bond (3 open felonies, threatening behavior). State raises competency. Court orders $3,000 Cash Bond and that a competency evaluation be completed.
Branch 5 to schedule Competency Hearing.

Conditions: 
No contact with Micon Downtown Cinema.
No contact with Officer Adam Phillips outside their official capacity.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:25 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tyler V Bronstad appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared by video for Tyler V Bronstad.
Defendant is advised of charges and potential penalties by the Court.
While going over bond conditions requested by the State, the defendant disconnected the video appearance.
Court notes the defendant is waiving right to a personal appearance at this time.
Attorney Schmidt advises the defendant should be eligible for Public Defender representation.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on February 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

*Not mailed, defendant's address listed as 'Homeless'.*

Conditions:

(Case called at 11:08 am and 11:10 am.)  Court Commissioner Nathan Novak for Branch 4
Defendant Tyler Bronstad appeared in custody with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier by video conference from EC Jail.  State by Andrew Gunderson ADA
Defendant ended video conference call at 11:09 am and left the room.
State requests $3000 cash bond.  No objection by defense..  Granted.
AIA:  02-07-22 at 11 am.

No contact with Micon Downtown Cinema.
No contact with Officer Phillips unless in their official capacity.

(Case called at 11:28 AM- by Zoom) No appearance by Defendant Tyler Bronstad. Attorney Karl Schmidt appears by video from the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates the Defendant will not come out of his cell and refused to meet with him. Court finds good cause to continue the initial appearance and any time limits until tomorrow. 
Initial Appearance: 02/04/2022 at 11:00 AM.
